frame.name: Ingredients
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Material</fen> is used to make a <fen>Product</fen>.
<ex>These <fex name="use">cooking</fex> <t><fex name="mat">ingredients</fex></t> are readily available.</ex>
<ex>An <fex name="des">aberrant</fex> <fex name="pro">hemoglobin</fex> <t><fex name="mat">precursor</fex></t> has been discovered to be implicated.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity which is used to make a <fen>Product</fen>.
<ex>Add all the <t><fex name="mat">ingredients</fex></t>, toss and chill.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category the <fen>Material</fen> belongs to. </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location that the <fen>Material</fen> comes from, including both extraction sites and emission/production sources.
</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Material</fen> is intended.
<ex>Supply and placing of <fex name="use">building</fex> <t>materials</t> shall be incidental to installation of the paving stones.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Product
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity or substance that is created out of the <fen>Material</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: ingredient.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: something that enters into a compound or becomes part of a combination or mixture.

lexUnit.name: precursor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a substance from which another is formed, especially by metabolic reaction

lexUnit.name: material.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the matter from which a thing is or can be made

lexUnit.name: component.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a part or element of a larger whole, especially a part of a machine or vehicle.

lexUnit.name: element.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the most basic factor or part that makes up something
